oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Incidence and Impact of Clinical Endometritis in Dairy Cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: LeBlanc, Stephen
Leslie, Ken
Duffield, Todd
Bateman, Ken
Keefe, Greg
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Endometritis
reproductive performance
subinvolution
bacterial uterine infection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Endometritis is a localized inflammation and/or infection of the uterus, characterized by subinvolution, and associated with chronic bacterial uterine infection and purulent discharge. Diagnosis and treatment of endometritis is a source of controversy among practitioners fueled by lack of large-scale clinical trials with objective case definitions and economically meaningful outcomes. Objectives of this study were to assess diagnostic criteria for endometritis and quantify its impact on reproductive performance.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2000; 165-166
